title: Yorkshire breaking news: Latest updates - BBC News
summary: leeds girl 's hair trapped in pool filter horror .
theresa may on the campaign trail in yorkshire .
murder investigation in pontefract after woman 's body found .
'outrage ' over expansion plans for north yorkshire village .
man arrested after serious sexual assault in york .
£ 200k breast cancer research boost for sheffield uni .
british steel to award staff 5 % stake in company .
hockney exhibition 'most visited ' in tate gallery history .
forty five new flats to be built at sheffield united ground .

documents.title: that 's all from thursday
text: those are all our updates from across yorkshire on thursday 1 june 2017 .
want the latest news , sport , weather and travel details from where you live on friday 2 june ?
just click here .

documents.title: our five top stories today
text: that 's all from us for today , we 'll be back tomorrow from 06:30 with all the latest news , sport , weather and travel for yorkshire .
updates on breaking news will continue throughout the night , but before we go , let 's look back at some of our top stories from today :
see you tomorrow

documents.title: horsing around - police style
text: if you follow west yorkshire police horses on twitter , this one 's for you :
`` 18,000 followers on twitter !
thank you everybody ! ! ! ''
good to see you 're keeping up the good work - well done steve !
cheers rob
wow true stars now
neigh !
so many ?
amazing and no thumbs either !
# 999family members everywhere .
so why the long face
great result !
but why still the long faces ?
18,001 followers now
your very welcome
what a mouth , what a mouth , what a north and south , blimey what a mouth he 's got
a horse walks into a bar , the barman says why the long face neigh
congratulations all xx

documents.title: police issue 'no insurance , no car ' warning
text: south yorkshire police have issued a `` no insurance , no car '' warning to motorists .
3,224 vehicles have been seized by the force in the last year .
as well as your car being seized , you could also get a fine and six points on your licence .
author: Kevin Larkin
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: forecast for tonight and tomorrow
text: it 's been another splendid day across yorkshire , here 's what the near future holds in store for us :
tonight a dry and warm night with broken cloud , lows of around 13c ( 55f ) .
a bright start in places for tomorrow , but it 'll soon cloud over with a little patchy rain spreading eastwards .
but all is not lost for sunshine fans , with brighter conditions returning later .
maximum temperature 20c ( 68f ) .
author: Paul Hudson
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: rotherham community officer wins gold
text: a rotherham community police officer has won a gold medal .
pcso ernie mpundu is now the police indoor sports table tennis champion 2017 .
it 's a contrast to his day job tackling anti-social behaviour in rotherham town centre .
a rumour from south yorkshire police suggests he 'll play colleagues using his mobile instead of a bat .
author: Kevin Larkin
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: morrisons fined £ 55,000 over mouldy pies
text: bradford-based supermarket morrisons has been fined £ 55,000 for food hygiene offences , including selling mouldy pork pies .
inspectors also found staff at the store in fleet , hampshire were handling bread while wearing dirty uniforms .
the firm pleaded guilty to four offences under food safety and hygiene regulations , at a hearing at basingstoke magistrates ' court .
the supermarket apologised and said it had improved food hygiene .

documents.title: general election 2017 : theresa may in pontefract
text: theresa may has been in pontefract this afternoon on the campaign trail :
she was asked if next polling day `` could n't come soon enough , given the state of the opinion polls ? ''
the prime minister replied that the only poll that mattered was the one on election day .
`` we 'll see what happens '' she added .
mrs may was speaking to - and being questioned by - workers at a furniture-making factory .

documents.title: police investigate suspected arson in sheffield
text: police are investigating a suspected arson attack on a house in sheffield .
something was poured through the letterbox of a property on montford drive in burngreave and set alight while people were asleep upstairs .
the front door and hallway were damaged but no-one was hurt .
anyone with information is asked to contact south yorkshire police on 101 .
author: Kevin Larkin
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: leeds girl in holiday pool ordeal
text: a six-year-old girl almost drowned when her hair was sucked into a swimming pool filter , her mother has said .
darcey morgan , from leeds , was trapped for more than two minutes when she became stuck underwater at a resort hotel in lanzarote .
she was given cpr by the poolside before being rushed to hospital in arrecife where she was kept overnight .
her mother alex said fellow holidaymakers helped to pull darcey to safety .
travel company first choice said it had launched a `` full and thorough investigation '' into the incident .

documents.title: leeds climber scales height of mars 's highest mountain
text: a novice climber has scaled the equivalent height of the solar system 's highest mountain - just eight months after being introduced to the sport .
author: Yorkshire Evening Post

documents.title: planning go ahead for bramall lane flats in sheffield
text: approval has been given for a devlopment on the corner of sheffield united 's ground .
45 flats will be built as well as a 6,600 square foot superstore selling blades merchandise .
it 's part of the club 's long term business plan .
author: Kevin Larkin
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: man arrested after serious assault in york
text: a man has been arrested this afternoon following a serious sexual assault in york in the early hours of monday morning .
he was identified after a cctv appeal earlier today .
police say that he is expected to remain in custody overnight for questioning .

documents.title: up a creek without a paddle ? fundraisers look for rowing help
text: a team of charity fundraisers in doncaster has volunteered for a rowing challenge .
but they 're up a creek without a paddle unless someone with experience of rowing can help steer them in the right direction .
the st john 's hos staff will field a team for the doncaster lakeside dragon boat race next month .
anyone available for the event on 15 july and for training beforehand is asked to get in touch .
you can call chris smith on 01302 798391 or lindsey richards on 01302 796662 .
author: Kevin Larkin
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: listen : sheffield 'people 's march for education '
text: a big education march starts in sheffield today .
the president of the national union of teachers is leading what they are calling a people 's march for education .
the walking starts in sheffield , passes through dronfield and chesterfield before reaching a rally in nottingham on saturday .
simon murch is joint division secretary of the nut in sheffield .
he says they want to highlight the possible impact of the election on school funding in the city :

documents.title: community club together to rebuild burned-down shed
text: how about this to restore your faith in humanity .
after sally 's shed was burned down on the allotment she shares with her dad , total strangers donated money to replace it and the tools she lost .
it 's suspected that the shed was set alight deliberately , but this story has a happy ending :

documents.title: views sought over south yorkshire policing shake-up
text: if you live in south yorkshire , your views are being sought over how your area is policed .
it comes as south yorkshire police considers changing the structure of its local forces .
you can complete the online survey here .
author: Kevin Larkin
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: alien fighting hardware on display in leeds
text: but i thought alien was just a film ?
let 's hope it 's a prop :
have you seen the m41a pulse rifle from # aliens ( 1986 ) is now on display in our self-defence gallery in # leeds :

documents.title: university of bradford project to help improve support for younger dementia sufferers
text: a new alzheimer 's society funded project at the university of bradford is to focus on improving support given to younger people diagnosed with dementia .
author: Bradford Telegraph and Argus

documents.title: investigations after doncaster man found dead
text: investigations are taking place after the death of a man in doncaster .
emergency services were called to elmfield road on 14 may at 22:30 after reports of a group of men fighting in the street .
a 57-year-old man was taken to hospital but died several days later .
a post mortem failed to determine why he died so further tests have been requested .
four men , aged 29 , 37 , 41 and 48-years-old , were arrested on sus of assault and have since been bailed .
author: Kevin Larkin
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: new campaign aims at making sheffield move more
text: a new campaign has been launched in sheffield to encourage more people to get active .
the move more campaign is especially focusing on office workers .
it 's hoped the promotion will make sheffield britain 's most active city by 2020 .
author: Kevin Larkin
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: cctv image released of missing hebden bridge man
text: police in hebden bridge have released a cctv image of a man who 's been missing for a week .
christopher mulligan disappeared on 25 may and the above cctv image is from that day .
police say if you know where mr mulligan is , you should call them urgently .
he was last seen wearing black trainers , grey tracksuit bottoms and a grey hoody with red writing across the chest .
we now know what christopher was wearing when he was last seen and we believe he may have been in hebden bridge that afternoon . ''

documents.title: 'putting ' the art into crazy golf in york
text: york art gallery is `` playing a round '' with the notion of art .
the gallery 's doug fishbone 's leisure land golf installation is a fully playable crazy golf course , with each hole designed and made by a different artist from the contemporary art world .
apparently , visitors interacting with the pieces through playing a round of crazy golf can `` engage with important cultural to including migration , global warming and globalisation '' .
the artworks ask visitors to `` explore the histories and relationships between work , leisure , colonialism , tourism , information and economics '' , the gallery adds .
and if you do n't feel you 're fully appreciating these concepts , at least you get to have a bit of fun with a club and ball

documents.title: polar bears enjoy the sun at yorkshire wildlife park
text: we 've been sent this great photo by bbc weather watcher mitch clive .
it shows polar bears at the yorkshire wildlife park near doncaster enjoying the summer sun !
author: Kevin Larkin
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: stone to be laid to commemorate ilkley soldier 's bravery
text: a stone will be laid at the weekend to commemorate a world war one hero from ilkley who was awarded the victoria cross .
2nd lt harold maufe was given the honour after he put out a fire at an ammunition dump which had been hit by a shell .
the ceremony is on sunday at the memorial gardens in ilkley and is part of an initiative to honour and recognise those who were given the victoria cross across the uk .
each stone marks 100 years since the recipients were awarded the medals .
harold survived the war and joined the home guard win world wart two , but died in a training exercise .
by his great promptitude , resource and entire disregard of his own personal safety , he set an exceptionally fine example to all ranks . ''

documents.title: watkins to join norwich from barnsley
text: watkins to join norwich from barnsley

documents.title: doncaster sign grimsby defender andrew
text: doncaster sign grimsby defender andrew

documents.title: search for sheffield man wanted in connection with assault
text: police are asking for help in finding christopher helliwell ( who officers want to speak to in connection with an assault in sheffield earlier this year .
the 46-year-old is believed to be in the longley area of sheffield or the treeton area of rotherham .
police say he knows he is wanted and is avoiding being arrested .
anyone who knows where he is or has information about his whereabouts is being asked not to approach him but to call 999 .
author: Kevin Larkin
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: hockney exhibition most visited in tate gallery history
text: an exhibition showcasing a lifetime of artwork by world famous yorkshire artist david hockney has become the most visited at london 's tate gallery .
on average more than 4,000 people visited the gallery each day between february and may to see the biggest ever compilation of work by the bradford-born artist .
the work spanned six decades and featured more than 200 pieces , including many that were made in east yorkshire .
author: Anne-Marie Tasker
BBC Look North

documents.title: listen : yorkshire wildlife trust 's 'get back to nature ' message
text: if you want to feel fitter and happier , why not make nature and the countryside a bigger part of your life ?
that 's the advice from the yorkshire wildlife trust .
the trust is challenging people to make every day in june a `` wild day '' , by either visiting rural areas or just taking more notice of green spaces and the creatures living in them .
the organisation 's west yorkshire director caroline thorogood says it 's been proved that getting back to nature is good for us :

documents.title: twelve admit leeds halloween bikers ' 'ride-out '
text: twelve people have admitted causing a public nuisance following a so-called halloween `` ride out '' involving bikers in leeds .
the 11 men and one woman were arrested after the incident on 31 october last year , and they each admitted charges of causing a public nuisance .
motorbikes and quad bikes were driven up and down kirkstall road and through the pedestrian areas of the city centre .
they 're due to be sentenced at leeds crown court on 10 july .
another defendant denied the charge of causing a public nuisance and will go on trial at leeds crown court on 28 november .
a further defendant has yet to enter a plea to the same charge .

documents.title: death announced of coronation street actor roy barraclough
text: former coronation street star roy barraclough has died at the age of 81 .
a spokesman for the lancashire-born actor , who played alec gilroy in the itv soap , said he died following a short illness .
barraclough kicked off his career as a comedian and pianist at a holiday camp on the isle of wight , before joining the huddersfield repertory company .
his other tv work included roles in west yorkshire-based last of the summer wine and last tango in halifax .

documents.title: british steel gives staff stake in firm
text: british steel gives staff stake in firm

documents.title: cctv appeal over serious sexual assault in york
text: do you know this man ?
police in york have released a cctv image of a man they want to speak to after a teenager was seriously sexually assaulted .
officers say the attack happened in the early hours of monday and that the victim is receiving support from specially trained police officers while the investigation continues .
police say the cctv image was taken from the kuda nightclub on clifford street at around 02:45 .

documents.title: yorkshire sign kohler-cadmore from worcs
text: yorkshire sign kohler-cadmore from worcs

documents.title: new cancer drugs 'within five to seven years ' - sheffield uni scientists
text: scientists at the university of sheffield say they hope new cancer drugs could be in clinics within seven years .
it comes as researchers there are given a £ 200,000 grant to study the link between breast and bone cancer .
professor ali gartland , from the university , says progress made by others could speed their project up :
author: Kevin Larkin
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: 'safety our utmost concern ' - leeds festival organisers
text: following last week 's terror attack at the ariana grande concert at the manchester arena , organisers of the leeds festival are reassuring festival-goers that their safety is paramount .
they say security talks will continue right up until the event gets under way at bramham park in august .
festival republic says it speaks regularly with the authorities and shares intelligence throughout the season in order to protect music fans .

in a statement , festival republic says safety is its `` utmost concern '' and the festival perimeter , arena , backstage and offsite areas are all `` robustly controlled and managed by security experts '' .

documents.title: in morning glory in 'god 's own county '
text: i sometimes think the term `` god 's own county '' - which is often used when referring to our beautiful county of yorkshire - is a bit self-aggrandising .
then these two came in this morning and now i 'm not so sure :
is this the grand canyon ?
nope !
it 's sunrise from ingleborough in north yorkshire , looking over the yorkshire dales .
thanks to charlie , who clearly had a beautiful start to the day , for sending this in .
and here 's another beauty .
this was taken by dave eaton at crow point farm at boothtown near halifax :
we really enjoy receiving your photographs .
why not send your own of yorkshire 's glory by simply clicking here ?
author: Andrew Barton
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: one love manchester concert tickets go on sale
text: tickets for the concert to benefit the victims of the manchester attack have gone on sale .
one love manchester takes place on sunday , with proceeds going to the red cross 's manchester emergency fund .
a total of 22 people died - including five people from yorkshire - and 116 were injured in a suicide bombing at an ariana grande concert at manchester arena last week .
grande will play at the benefit gig alongside take that , niall horan , katy perry , miley cyrus and justin bieber .

documents.title: man arrested after woman 's body found in pontefract
text: a 54-year-old man has been arrested on sus of murderafter a woman , believed to be in her 80s , was found at a house in pontefract last night .
police were called to the house , on park lane , at about 22:30 yesterday after an ambulance had attended the scene .
a post-mortem examination is due to be carried out later , meanwhile `` enquiries remain ongoing '' , say police .

documents.title: breakingmurder investigation in pontefract
text: police have launched a murder investigation after a woman , believed to be in her 80s , was found dead at a house in pontrefract .
more details to follow .

documents.title: watch : the power of football revealed in barnsley
text: refugees and asylum seekers are showing their love of football in barnsley as part of a community project .
refugee tigers , run by barnsley fc 's reds in the community , has players from iran , eritrea and sudan among others .
about 30 players get a weekly coaching session followed by a match .
they say it keeps them fit and helps improve their english language skills :

documents.title: watch : york 's 'bee ' tattoo solidarity with manchester bomb victims
text: you might remember that yesterday we mentioned a tattoo parlour in richmond , north yorkshire , which is raising money to help the families of those affected by the manchester terror attack .
staff said they 'd been inundated with requests for tattoos featuring a bee design - a symbol of manchester - to show solidarity with the victims of the suicide attack .
now it seems that people in york have been getting bee tattoos as well to show their support .
york tattoo studios says it 's had back-to-back bookings for the tattoos and they 're helping to raise money for those affected :

documents.title: diamonds and sapphires stolen in huddersfield burglary
text: a `` significant amount '' of jewellery has been stolen from a house in huddersfield .
valuable watches and diamond rings were taken from a home on elmfield drive in skelmanthorpe in the early hours of last friday , police say .
some of the stolen items stolen include :
police are urging anyone with information about the burglary to come forward , as well as anyone who has seen the items for sale or who 's been offered them .

documents.title: in leeds ' not-so-supertram
text: just a quick bit of social history : it was on this day in 1911 that leeds and bradford became the first places in the uk to have electric trams .
here they are in 1921 on boar lane in leeds .
i 'm not even going to mention the supertram or the leeds trolleybus scheme
author: Nick Wilmshurst
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: watch : a cloudy start , brighter later
text: it 's a dry but rather cloudy morning so far for yorkshire .
however , as time goes on the cloud will break to allow some brighter spells to develop .
watch my full forecast here :
author: Abbie Dewhurst
Weather Presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: teenager racially abused on train to sheffield
text: a 15-year-old boy was racially abused on a train heading to sheffield , police have revealed .
the incident happened on the manchester to sheffield train at about 18:40 on 1 may .
british transport police has released an image of a man they want to speak about the incident :
the man got off the train when it arrived in sheffield .
anyone with information is asked to get in touch with police .

documents.title: brexit expert answers viewer questions
text: brexit expert answers viewer questions

documents.title: listen : 'outrage ' over expansion plans for north yorkshire village
text: people living in part of north yorkshire say they 're `` outraged '' by plans which would increase the size of their village almost eight-fold .
developers want to build 3,000 homes in green hammerton , near york .
villagers say building on a former golf course off the a1 is more appropriate and the plans are `` ridiculous '' .
harrogate council says it wo n't comment until after a meeting this evening .
the chairman of keep green hammerton green , chris chelton , says the village ca n't cope with any growth :

documents.title: former wakefield youth centre damaged in blaze
text: a former youth centre in normanton near wakefield has been gutted by fire overnight .
fire crews were called to the blaze at the building on wakefield road in normanton at about 01:30 this morning .
at its height about 25 firefighters from normanton , castleford , featherstone and wakefield tackled the blaze in the single-storey building .

documents.title: £ 200k breast cancer research boost for sheffield uni
text: scientists at the university of sheffield have received a major grant to support their research into the link between breast and bone cancer .
over 1,000 women in south yorkshire are diagnosed with breast cancer every year .
the money has come from the research charity breast cancer now and will be used to see if a drug can stop cancer moving to different parts of the body .
work at the university has found that breast cancers can change the structure of bone to make it easier to spread there .
a team from the university of sheffield has been conducting research over the last two years into what makes patients so susceptible .

documents.title: thursday 's yorkshire weather
text: a dry but cloudy start with the odd spot of rain in the west .
through the morning the cloud will break to allow some brighter spells to develop .
it 'll be dry through the evening with some sunny spells .
overnight , the cloud will tend to build from the west , perhaps with some rain arriving into western areas by dawn .

documents.title: watch : aristocrat cleared of dangerous driving after crash
text: an aristocrat who caused a three-car crash on a busy road has been cleared of dangerous driving .
lady susan zetland , 77 , of aske hall , near richmond , north yorkshire , tried to cross the a66 at the hargill junction on 4 july .
teesside crown court heard there was a contraflow put in place and cones indicating cars should only turn left onto the dual carriageway .
zetland had admitted careless driving , but denied being dangerous .
after three hours of deliberation , jurors cleared her of the more serious charge .

documents.title: tickets go on sale for manchester attack benefit gig
text: tickets are due to go on sale later for the concert in aid of those affected by the manchester bombing .
ariana grande will be joined by the likes of justin bieber and coldplay at the one love manchester show at old trafford cricket ground on sunday .
the one love manchester show will raise money for those affected by the blast which left 22 dead , including five people from yorkshire .
proceeds will go to the we love manchester emergency fund , which has been set up by manchester city council , in conjunction with the british red cross .
organisers expect at least £ 2m to be raised from the event .

documents.title: check your rail journey this morning
text: on the rails across yorkshire so far today there are no major delays or cancellations posted .
click on the links below to keep up-to-date with the live departure boards for :
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: good morning : join us for today 's live coverage across yorkshire
text: hello and welcome to bbc local live in yorkshire on thursday 1 june 2017 .
we 'll be with you throughout the day with all the latest news , sport , weather and travel updates .
given it 's the meteorological start of summer today , starting with a sunny shot of yorkshire seemed like a good idea :
weather watcher sandie 's valley sent in this `` busy sky over rhododendrons growing on the edge of butterley reservoir at marsden '' .
if you snap anything interesting which you 'd like to show off to the rest of yorkshire , you can send it in by simply clicking here .
author: Andrew Barton
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire
